text: Richard Nixon once famously said he gave
his enemies a sword this president might
have just given them a chainsaw I'm Sam
tannin house of the new york times
whether or not President Obama used the
IRS to punish political enemies is
unclear but the question is arisen for a
reason some of his predecessors did
richard nixon went farthest he ordered
the agency to investigate top Democrats
including Edmund muskie Hubert Humphrey
and Ted Kennedy all possible challengers
to Nixon in the nineteen seventy two
election when the white house counsel
objected a Nixon advisor told him if the
president wants you to turn the IRS
loose then you turn the IRS loose
eventually the list of targets would
reach 1,000 groups and four thousand
individuals their names secretly stored
and locked in an IRS basement John F
Kennedy became alarmed at the growing
influence of anti-government groups he
had the director of audits collect
intelligence on extremist organizations
like the John Birch Society decades
earlier Franklin Roosevelt used the IRS
to go after newspaper publishers and
political rivals including the populace
Huey Long on the other hand National
Review editors speculated that Dwight
Eisenhower delayed a tax investigation
against congressman Adam Clayton Powell
jr. after the Democrat surprisingly
endorsed ike for president
you
